arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Cardiff as fightback after woeful defending in vain
arts.sum: Stoke came back from 2-0 down in opening stages scarred by some dreadful defending to lead 3-2 in normal time thanks to a double from Lewis Koumas and penalty from Lewis Baker. Wilson-Esbrand took a throw-in by the left corner flag and Burger dummied for Koumas to run into the area across the touchline, take a touch onto his right foot and slide it under Ethan Horvath for the equaliser.

arts.ttl: Ethan Horvath shines in shootout as Cardiff advance on penalties
arts.sum: Rubin Colwill scored the winning penalty.

arts.ttl: Stoke City 3-3 Cardiff City (2-4 on Pens)
arts.sum: The forward’s solo effort saw him cut inside from the right wing with the ball at his feet, being given plenty of time and space as he worked his way to the edge of the area before dispatching beautifully with his left foot. Following a promising start, City were ahead inside the opening ten minutes thanks to Rubin Colwill .

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Cardiff as Mark Robins makes seven changes
arts.sum: Stoke: Bonham, Tchamadeu, Rose, Gibson, Wilson-Esbrand, Burger, Baker, Vidigal, Junho, Koumas, Tezgel. Mark Robins has made seven changes to the starting XI and put Favour Fawunmi and Ruben Curley straight on the bench as Stoke City take on Cardiff in the FA Cup fourth round.

arts.ttl: Stoke vs Cardiff TV channel, live stream details and kick off time
arts.sum: Stoke City are back in action at the Bet365 Stadium this weekend as they host fellow second-tier outfit Cardiff City in the FA Cup fourth round. Stoke's home game against Cardiff in the FA Cup fourth round will take place on Saturday, February 8.

arts.ttl: Stoke City chairman confirms stance on Financial Fair Play rules
arts.sum: Coates has held up his hands that Stoke have made their own mistakes which haven't helped their cause on the pitch, such as the transfer window in summer 2018 after they had been relegated, but he makes the case that the current fair play rules in the Championship are "not fit for purpose". The minutes said: "Chair John Coates attended to meet with Stoke City Connect members as a group, with the conversation ranging from his passion for the DNA of hard work, togetherness and personal accountability that he sees as integral to the club on-and-off the field, flexible financial planning and the lessons he has learned through experience during his time as owner of the club.

arts.ttl: Stoke City were right to reject Wouter Burger transfer bid and this is why
arts.sum: Never mind whether or not they were prevented from doing business by Financial Fair Play constraints, I have kept saying this season that the players are already there and, with the right manager, we will now look like a different team without having to go into the transfer market. There are ways to organise training to have a good look at the capabilities of the players in particular areas and he’ll be able to sound out the opinions of the two coaches he’s brought with him as well as Ryan Shawcross and Jon Walters, who will know them all well and understand strengths and weaknesses.

Entry for this Saturday's match at Cardiff International Sports Campus will be free for all supporters. We always have that feeling, even if we’re one or two down, that we’re going to have a chance to win the game.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins watches Day One training to give Stoke City progress report
arts.sum: Stoke head into this game on the back of a massive 2-1 win at Hull in the Championship last weekend and there is a chance to reach the last 16, a chance for forwards like Emre Tezgel to make an impression as cup-tied Nathan Lowe and Ali Al-Hamadi watch from the stands, and a chance to build positive momentum. “That in itself means that one or two are going to get opportunities but they have to earn them as well and the very fact that we’re getting players back – slowly but surely we’re getting players back and hopefully we don’t lose any more or too many more or for too long a time – means that the levels of training go up and the competitive edge comes back into it, the drive and challenge for places in the team goes up and we’ve got a situation where that then pushes people on.

arts.ttl: Stoke City make quick swoop for attacker after West Ham release
arts.sum: Stoke City have signed teenage forward Favour Fawunmi after his exit from West Ham last week, it has… The post Stoke City make quick swoop for attacker after West Ham release appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
